# 總裁報告

2018年是全球金融危機發生十周年，十年間國際政經形勢經歷巨大轉變，當中不乏一幕幕超乎最佳編劇所能想像的場景。我在去年的年報指出，2017年金融市場表現是「喜出望外」，同時提到前景「潛藏隱憂」。回顧2018年，或許可形容為「先喜後悲」。環球多個股票指數在1月創出歷史新高後不久，熾熱的投資情緒旋即遇上中美貿易摩擦的冷鋒，加上英國脫歐談判一直拉鋸、地緣政治惡化、美聯儲四次加息等因素，市場樂觀氣氛急劇逆轉，資產價格在年內大幅下跌。MSCI全球指數從高點至低點曾下跌20.3%，全年累跌約一成，是2008年環球金融危機以來表現最差的一年。恒生指數從高點最多曾下跌26.7%，全年下挫13.6%，錄得七年來最大年度跌幅。

# 聯匯穩健 信心所繫

儘管外圍形勢波動難測，香港金融體系仍然保持穩健，貨幣市場運作暢順無阻。實施三十五年的聯繫匯率制度成功應對了資金流出港元的考驗。自環球金融危機爆發以來，累積約10,000億港元等值的資金流入港元。去年，隨着美國息率上升，港美息差持續擴闊，「沽港元、買美元」套息活動增加，港元兌美元匯率在年初轉弱，2005年制訂的「弱方兌換保證」，自4月首度觸發後，年內再觸發26次。金管局按照既定機制，履行「買港元、沽美元」的弱方兌換保證，有序、透明地在市場承接1,035億港元的港元沽盤。隨着資金流走，一個月香港銀行同業拆息在2018年內累升了105基點，而銀行亦在去年9月美國加息後，上調了最優惠利率。金管局多次和適時通過不同渠道向公眾闡釋「弱方兌換保證」的運作機制，令公眾了解資金流出港元是香港利率正常化的必經過程，也是聯匯制度的正常運作。國際貨幣基金組織在去年年底重申支持香港聯匯制度的立場，特區政府也強調聯匯是香港貨幣穩定的基石。這都有助於穩定香港市民對聯繫匯率的信心。

# 銀行體系 穩中有進

2008年環球金融危機暴露了全球金融系統潛藏的種種弊端及隱患，促使國際間在過去十年協調推出一系列針對金融市場、金融機構的改革，包括在銀行業監管方面，提升企業管治和風險管理。金管局的銀行監管工作重點針對兩方面：一是着眼於銀行資產負債風險的審慎監管，二是銀行的行為操守，二者不可偏廢。資產負債風險監管方面，金管局作為巴塞爾銀行監管委員會(Basel Committee on Banking Supervision)及二十國集團轄下金融穩定理事會(FinancialStability Board)成員，有責任全面落實國際監管標準，確保香港銀行業穩健審慎地經營業務。去年底香港銀行資本充足率達20.3%，不但遠高於國際最低標準要求的8%，也較環球金融危機時的14.7%水平顯著提升。大型銀行去年第四季平均流動覆蓋比率達167.6%，同樣遠高於法定最低要求的90%。與此同時，為避免重蹈環球金融危機時需動用公帑拯救「大得不能倒」金融機構的覆轍，金融穩定理事會制訂了關於金融機構處置機制的國際標準。香港是亞洲區內少數已經全面落實符合機制要求的地區之一，金管局下設的處置機制辦公室正落實該機制的操作細則，要求銀行推行結構性變動令處置預案在需要時能有效實施，去年亦推出了《吸收虧損能力規則》，未來還會陸續推出更多相關規則。

鑑於樓價持續上升，金管局未雨綢繆，在2009至2017年間共推出八輪逆周期措施，確保一旦地產市況逆轉，本港銀行體系有足夠的抗震能力應對衝擊。這些措施成效顯著：新造住宅平均按揭成數由2009年的64%降至2018年底的46%；平均供款與入息比率亦由2010年的41%下調至2018年底的34%。年內銀行信貸錄得4.4%的溫和增長，整體資產質素維持良好，零售銀行不良貸款比率進一步降至0.5%，遠低於國際及本港歷史平均水平。去年銀行業盈利持續增長，整體股東權益回報率連升兩年至13%；多家國際性銀行集團在本港的業務交出了不俗的成績表，成為集團盈利的重要支柱。

# 穩善文化 上行下效

在監管銀行的行為操守方面，金管局在2010年增設銀行操守部，促進銀行公平待客，並加強保障消費者權益。要做到標本兼治，除了訂出各種針對銀行營運基本操守的監管要求外，我們近年來大力推動改革銀行文化，鼓勵銀行循管治、獎勵制度、評估與回饋機制三方面推動穩善文化，務求銀行內部做到上行下效，在根本上恢復、提升客戶對銀行的信任和尊重。繼2017年金管局向全港銀行提供具體的指引，金管局在2018年底進一步推出銀行文化的監管措施，包括要求銀行就企業文化和落實有關措施作出自我評估等，令穩善銀行文化的三大支柱能有效執行。

雖然互聯網和移動金融是全球趨勢，金管局去年仍繼續促進普及金融，照顧未能應用新科技的社群。例如我們連同香港銀行公會推動便利店推出長者透過「易辦事」免購物提款服務，有關便利店網絡已增至逾300家；我們並聯絡香港郵政在7家主要位於離島和新界的郵政局推出長者提款易服務。銀行業界響應金管局的建議，年內積極增加無障礙設施，提供傷健共融的銀行服務，例子之一是設有聲音導航的自動櫃員機數目一年內增加逾十倍至超過700部。另外，在金管局積極推動下，我們預期將會陸續有銀行在偏遠地區開設更多實體分行和增設流動銀行服務，便利市民。

# 智慧銀行 嶄新體驗

金管局與銀行和科技業界緊密合作，在2017年9月啟動「智慧銀行新紀元」，推動香港金融科技發展和創新，為市民帶來嶄新的支付和銀行服務體驗。2018年的亮點，無疑是在9月正式開通的「轉數快」。它是全球獨一無二的零售快速支付系統，打破香港各種電子支付工具和銀行帳戶之間的屏障，讓市民享受全年無休的港元和人民幣即時轉帳服務。金管局還同步推出全球首個「共用二維碼」標準和應用程式，商戶可憑單個二維碼接通多個電子支付系統。「轉數快」推出以來深受市民歡迎，短短半年，登記紀錄已逾258萬個，日均交易量達6萬宗，平均每宗金額分別20,700港元和38,000元人民幣。

去年5月，金管局發出虛擬銀行的認可指引，隨即有33家機構提交虛擬銀行牌照的申請。截至今年四月中，四個牌照已經發出，預期它們將於年內正式投入營運。虛擬銀行有助推動香港金融科技發展和創新，為個人和中小企提供嶄新服務和體驗，並促進普及金融。

此外，金管局在7月發布開放應用程式介面(OpenAPI)框架，銀行將分四階段開放產品和服務的對外接口，開創更靈活、更開放的金融科技環境，讓銀行客戶更便捷地整合帳戶資料、獲取資訊，選取貼合自己需要的服務。年內，共有42項新科技產品使用金管局的金融科技監管沙盒進行測試，當中28項完成試行，有關產品和服務已順利推出市場。

金管局聯同多家銀行研發的「貿易聯動」去年10月正式啟用，這個採用「分布式分類帳技術」的貿易融資平台，將提升銀行審批貿易融資的效率。「貿易聯動」目前正在測試連接其他地區相關平台，以促進跨境貿易融資活動。

金融科技不但廣泛應用於日常生活，近年更走進合規和監管領域。金管局鼓勵銀行運用合規科技(Regtech)協助處理日常營運如監察涉嫌洗錢和恐怖分子資金籌集的可疑活動。與此同時金管局正研究使用監管科技(Suptech)，進一步提升監管工作的效率和成效。

# 金融實力 鞏固提升

國際金融中心之間是軟實力的較量，我們要不斷順應經濟社會和科技發展的變化，把握機遇，不斷為香港金融業開拓新的發展空間。綠色金融就是香港開拓債券和項目融資市場的一個重大機遇。金管局支持和配合特區政府發展綠色金融，除了配合特區政府籌備1,000億港元的政府綠色債券發行計劃，我們去年還舉辦多場綠色金融研討會，包括兩場國際大型會議，以提升市場對綠色金融的認識、了解和參與，並鼓勵發行機構參與政府去年推出的綠色債券資助計劃和香港的綠色金融認證服務。去年在港發行綠色債券規模逾110億美元，相等於2017年的三倍多。

近年來投資界對基建和相關項目興趣日濃。金管局於2016年成立基建融資促進辦公室(IFFO)，合作夥伴至今已倍增至95家機構，成為區內基建融資的重要交流平台。去年金管局與國務院國有資產監督管理委員會（國資委）首次合辦高層圓桌會議，討論香港為中央國有企業「走出去」的獨特優勢和作用，為央企與香港金融、專業服務界日後共拓發展機遇奠下良好基礎。

# President's Report

2018 marked the 10th anniversary of the global financial crisis. Over the past decade, the international political and economic landscape has undergone significant changes, not without its share of scenes that even the most imaginative screenwriters could not have envisioned. In last year's annual report, I noted that the 2017 financial market performance was "surprisingly positive," while also highlighting "underlying concerns" about the outlook. Looking back at 2018, it might be characterized as "initial optimism followed by sorrow." After several global stock indices hit record highs in January, the fervent investment sentiment quickly encountered the cold front of Sino-U.S. trade tensions, compounded by prolonged Brexit negotiations, deteriorating geopolitical tensions, and the Federal Reserve's four interest rate hikes. The market's optimistic atmosphere rapidly reversed, leading to a sharp decline in asset prices throughout the year. The MSCI Global Index fell by 20.3% from its peak to its low point, with a full-year decline of about 10%, making it the worst-performing year since the 2008 global financial crisis. The Hang Seng Index fell by as much as 26.7% from its peak, with a full-year decline of 13.6%, marking the largest annual drop in seven years.

# Lianhui Steady, Confidence Rests Here

Despite the volatile and unpredictable external environment, Hong Kong's financial system has remained resilient, with smooth and unimpeded operations in the money market. The linked exchange rate system, in place for 35 years, has successfully withstood the challenge of capital outflows from Hong Kong dollars. Since the outbreak of the global financial crisis, approximately HKD 100 billion equivalent in capital has flowed into Hong Kong dollars. Last year, as U.S. interest rates rose, the interest rate differential between Hong Kong and the U.S. continued to widen, leading to an increase in "sell Hong Kong dollars, buy U.S. dollars" carry trade activities. The Hong Kong dollar weakened against the U.S. dollar at the beginning of the year, and the "weak-side exchange guarantee" established in 2005 was first triggered in April and triggered another 26 times during the year. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) fulfilled the weak-side exchange guarantee in accordance with the established mechanism, orderly and transparently absorbing HKD 103.5 billion in Hong Kong dollar sell orders in the market. As capital flowed out, the Hong Kong interbank offered rate rose by 105 basis points within a month in 2018, and banks also raised their prime lending rates after the U.S. interest rate hike in September last year. The HKMA has repeatedly and timely explained the operational mechanism of the "weak-side exchange guarantee" to the public through various channels, helping the public understand that capital outflows from Hong Kong dollars are a necessary process for the normalization of Hong Kong's interest rates and a normal operation of the linked exchange rate system. The International Monetary Fund (IMF) reaffirmed its support for Hong Kong's linked exchange rate system at the end of last year, and the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region government also emphasized that the linked exchange rate system is the cornerstone of Hong Kong's monetary stability. This has helped to stabilize Hong Kong residents' confidence in the linked exchange rate system.

#Banking System: Steady Progress

The 2008 global financial crisis exposed numerous hidden flaws and risks within the global financial system, prompting international coordination over the past decade to implement a series of reforms targeting financial markets and institutions. These reforms included enhancing corporate governance and risk management in the banking sector. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) focuses its banking supervision on two key areas: first, prudential regulation of banks' balance sheet risks, and second, the conduct of banks. Both aspects are equally important and cannot be neglected. In terms of balance sheet risk regulation, as a member of the Basel Committee on Banking Supervision and the Financial Stability Board under the G20, the HKMA has a responsibility to fully implement international regulatory standards, ensuring that Hong Kong's banking sector operates in a stable and prudent manner. At the end of last year, Hong Kong's banking sector achieved a capital adequacy ratio of 20.3%, which is not only significantly higher than the international minimum requirement of 8%, but also notably improved from the 14.7% level during the global financial crisis. In the fourth quarter of last year, the average liquidity coverage ratio of major banks reached 167.6%, far exceeding the statutory minimum requirement of 90%. Meanwhile, to avoid repeating the situation during the global financial crisis where public funds had to be used to rescue "too big to fail" financial institutions, the Financial Stability Board established international standards for the resolution mechanisms of financial institutions. Hong Kong is one of the few regions in Asia that has fully implemented mechanisms meeting these requirements. The HKMA's Resolution Mechanism Office is currently implementing the operational details of this mechanism, requiring banks to make structural changes to ensure that resolution plans can be effectively executed when necessary. Last year, the HKMA also introduced the "Loss Absorption Capacity Rules," and more related rules will be introduced in the future.

In response to the sustained rise in property prices, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) took proactive measures, implementing eight rounds of countercyclical policies between 2009 and 2017 to ensure that the local banking system had sufficient resilience to withstand potential shocks should the property market reverse. These measures proved highly effective: the average loan-to-value ratio for new residential mortgages fell from 64% in 2009 to 46% by the end of 2018; the average debt-to-income ratio also decreased from 41% in 2010 to 34% by the end of 2018. During the year, bank credit grew modestly by 4.4%, with overall asset quality remaining strong. The non-performing loan ratio for retail banking further declined to 0.5%, far below both international and local historical averages. Profitability in the banking sector continued to grow last year, with return on equity rising for two consecutive years to 13%. Several international banking groups operating in Hong Kong delivered impressive performance, becoming key pillars of their group profits.

# Stable Virtuous Culture Lead by Example

In regulating the conduct of banks, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) established the Bank Conduct Department in 2010 to promote fair treatment of customers and enhance consumer protection. To address both symptoms and root causes, in addition to setting regulatory requirements targeting the fundamental conduct of banking operations, we have actively promoted reforms in banking culture in recent years. We encourage banks to foster a culture of integrity through three key areas: governance, reward systems, and assessment and feedback mechanisms, aiming to ensure that banks lead by example internally and restore and enhance customers' trust and respect for banks at their core. Following the provision of specific guidelines to all Hong Kong banks in 2017, the HKMA further introduced regulatory measures on banking culture by the end of 2018, including requiring banks to conduct self-assessments on their corporate culture and implementation of related measures, thereby effectively enforcing the three pillars supporting a culture of integrity within banks.

Although the internet and mobile banking represent global trends, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) continued to promote financial inclusion last year, addressing communities that could not access new technologies. For example, we collaborated with the Hong Kong Bankers' Association to encourage convenience stores to offer elderly customers the "Easy Access" service for cash withdrawals without purchasing goods; the network of such convenience stores has now grown to over 300. Additionally, we worked with Hong Kong Post to introduce the "Elderly Withdrawal Easy" service at seven major post offices located in the outlying islands and New Territories. In response to HKMA's recommendations, the banking industry actively expanded accessible facilities and provided inclusive banking services for people with disabilities and the general public. One example is the number of voice-guided automated teller machines (ATMs), which increased more than tenfold within a year to over 700 units. Furthermore, under HKMA's active promotion, we expect banks to gradually open more physical branches and introduce mobile banking services in remote areas, offering greater convenience to the public.

# SmartBank New Experience

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) closely collaborated with banks and the technology industry to launch the "Smart Banking New Era" in September 2017, promoting the development and innovation of Hong Kong's financial technology and bringing citizens a new payment and banking service experience. A highlight of 2018 was the official launch of "Turns Fast" in September, a unique retail fast payment system globally that broke down barriers between various electronic payment tools and bank accounts in Hong Kong, offering citizens 24/7 instant transfer services in Hong Kong dollars and Chinese yuan. The HKMA also simultaneously introduced the world's first "shared QR code" standard and application, allowing merchants to connect to multiple electronic payment systems through a single QR code. Since its launch, "Turns Fast" has been widely welcomed by the public, with over 2.58 million registered accounts within just six months, achieving an average of 60,000 daily transactions, with average transaction amounts of HK$20,700 and RMB 38,000 respectively.

In May last year, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority issued guidelines for the approval of virtual banks, prompting 33 institutions to submit applications for virtual bank licenses. As of mid-April this year, four licenses have been granted, and they are expected to commence operations by the end of the year. Virtual banks contribute to advancing Hong Kong's fintech development and innovation, offering individuals and small and medium-sized enterprises novel services and experiences, while promoting financial inclusion.

In addition, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) released an Open Application Programming Interface (OpenAPI) framework in July. Banks will open external interfaces for their products and services in four phases, creating a more flexible and open fintech environment. This will enable bank customers to more conveniently integrate account data, access information, and choose services that best meet their needs. This year, a total of 42 new technology products have utilized HKMA's fintech regulatory sandbox for testing, of which 28 have completed their trials, and the related products and services have been successfully launched to the market.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA), in collaboration with multiple banks, officially launched "Trade Link" in October last year. This trade financing platform, which employs distributed ledger technology, aims to improve the efficiency of banks in processing trade financing applications. "Trade Link" is currently testing connections to related platforms in other regions to promote cross-border trade financing activities.

FinTech is not only widely applied in daily life but has also recently entered the fields of compliance and regulation. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) encourages banks to leverage compliance technology (Regtech) to assist with daily operations such as monitoring suspicious activities related to money laundering and the financing of terrorism. At the same time, the HKMA is exploring the use of regulatory technology (Suptech) to further enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of regulatory work.

# Financial Strength: Consolidate and Enhance

Competition among international financial centers is a contest of soft power. We must continuously adapt to changes in economic, social, and technological development, seize opportunities, and constantly expand new development space for Hong Kong's financial sector. Green finance represents a significant opportunity for Hong Kong to develop its bond and project financing markets. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) supports and collaborates with the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region government in advancing green finance. In addition to assisting the government in preparing a HKD 1,000 billion government green bond issuance program, we organized multiple green finance seminars last year, including two major international conferences, to enhance market awareness, understanding, and participation in green finance, and to encourage issuers to engage in the government's green bond subsidy program launched last year and Hong Kong's green finance certification services. The scale of green bond issuance in Hong Kong last year exceeded USD 110 billion, more than three times the amount in 2017.

In recent years, the investment community has shown increasing interest in infrastructure and related projects. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) established the Infrastructure Financing Facilitation Office (IFFO) in 2016. The number of partner institutions has more than doubled to 95, making it an important platform for infrastructure financing in the region. Last year, the HKMA and the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission (SASAC) co-hosted a high-level roundtable meeting for the first time, discussing Hong Kong's unique advantages and role in supporting the overseas expansion of central state-owned enterprises (SOEs). This meeting laid a solid foundation for future collaborative development opportunities between SOEs and Hong Kong's financial and professional service sectors.

# 2018年大事紀要

# 貨幣穩定

# 4月12日

金管局7.85港元兌1美元的弱方兌換保證於倫敦交易時段被觸發，這是2005年金管局推出3項優化聯繫匯率制度的措施以來弱方兌換保證首度被觸發。於2018年，弱方兌換保證合共被觸發27次。

# 7月24日

金管局與3間發鈔銀行公布推出2018香港新鈔票系列。

# 10月26日

金管局宣布指定9間認可機構作為香港離岸人民幣市場的一級流動性提供行。

# 銀行體系

# 1月10日

金管局公布由2019年1月1日起，香港適用的逆周期緩衝資本由1.875%上調至2.5%。

# 2月2日

《2018年打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（金融機構）（修訂）條例》刊憲。

# 2月28日

金融穩定理事會發出有關香港的同業評審報告，確認香港近年在場外衍生工具市場改革及設立金融機構處置框架方面進展理想。

# 3月23日

# Summary of Major Events in 2018

# Monetary Stability

# April 12th

The weak-side exchange guarantee of 7.85 Hong Kong dollars to 1 U.S. dollar was triggered during the London trading session, marking the first time since the Hong Kong Monetary Authority introduced three measures to optimize the linked exchange rate system in 2005 that the weak-side exchange guarantee was triggered. In 2018, the weak-side exchange guarantee was triggered a total of 27 times.

# July 24th

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority and three note-issuing banks announced the launch of the 2018 Hong Kong New Banknote Series.

# October 26th

The HKMA announced the designation of nine authorized institutions as primary liquidity providers in Hong Kong's offshore RMB market.

# Banking System

# January 10th

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority announced that the countercyclical capital buffer applicable to Hong Kong will be increased from 1.875% to 2.5%, effective January 1, 2019.

# February 2nd

The 2018 Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing (Financial Institutions) (Amendment) Ordinance is published in the Gazette.

# February 28

The Financial Stability Board issued a peer review report on Hong Kong, confirming that Hong Kong has made ideal progress in recent years in the reform of the over-the-counter derivatives market and the establishment of a financial institution resolution framework.

# March 23rd

The HKMA facilitated the Hong Kong Bankers Association in issuing the *Practical Guidelines for Accessible Banking Services*.

# May 4th

The Banking (Disclosure) (Amendment) Rules 2018 and the Banking (Specified Multilateral Development Banks) (Amendment) Notice 2018 were gazetted.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority issued the revised guidelines on the authorization of virtual banks after completing public consultations.

# October 3

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority is hosting the 2nd International Conference on Independent Non-Executive Directors in Hong Kong.

# October 19th

The Financial Institutions (Disposal Mechanism) (Loss Absorption Capacity Provisions - Banking Sector) Rules (Loss Absorption Capacity Rules) and the related 2018 Tax (Amendment) (No. 6) Ordinance Draft have been gazetted.

# October 26th

# November 16

The following documents have been gazetted: Notice No. 2 under the Banking (Amendment) Ordinance (Effective Date) 2018, the Banking (Risk Limitation) Rules, the Banking (Capital) (Amendment) Rules 2018, and the Banking (Disclosure) (Amendment) No. 2 Rules 2018.

# December 14th

The Loss Absorption Capacity Rule has taken effect.

# December 19th

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority has introduced regulatory measures (self-assessment, thematic assessments, and bank culture dialogues) to understand the progress of bank culture reforms in Hong Kong.

# December 21st

HKMA announces the latest list of authorized institutions designated as having local systemic importance.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority and the Investment Promotion Office co-hosted a seminar in Guangzhou with the theme "Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area • New Opportunities in Overseas Financial Management."

IFFO hosted a panel discussion on "Risk Mitigation in Infrastructure Investment and Financing" during the 3rd "Belt and Road Summit Forum".

# July 3

Bond Connect's one-year anniversary.

HKMA issues the open application programming interface (open API) framework for the Hong Kong banking sector.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) announced the "Global Financial Innovation Network" plan in collaboration with 11 financial regulatory authorities and related institutions.

Bond Connect fully implements the real-time delivery versus payment (DvP) settlement model.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority designated two retail payment systems under the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance (Chapter 584).

# 金管局簡介

香港金融管理局是香港的中央銀行機構，主要職能有4項：在聯繫匯率制度的架構內維持貨幣穩定；促進金融體系（包括銀行體系）的穩定與健全；協助鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位，包括維持與發展香港的金融基建；以及管理外匯基金。

# 金管局的法定授權

立法會（前稱立法局）於1992年通過《外匯基金條例》修訂條文，授權財政司司長（前稱財政司）委任金融管理專員，金管局隨後在1993年4月1日成立。

金融管理專員的權力、職能及責任由《外匯基金條例》、《銀行業條例》、《金融機構（處置機制）條例》、《存款保障計劃條例》、《支付系統及儲值支付工具條例》及其他有關條例明文規定。財政司司長與金融管理專員於2003年6月25日的互換函件，列載彼此在貨幣與金融事務方面的職能與責任的分配，亦披露財政司司長將若干權力轉授金融管理專員。有關函件為公開文件，可於金管局網站查閱。

外匯基金根據《外匯基金條例》設立，由財政司司長掌有控制權。該條例規定外匯基金須主要運用於影響港元匯價。財政司司長亦可運用外匯基金以保持香港貨幣金融體系的穩定與健全，藉此保持香港作為國際金融中心的地位。

金融管理專員根據《外匯基金條例》委任，以協助財政司司長執行其根據該條例獲授予的職能，以及執行其他條例及財政司司長所指派的職能。金融管理專員的辦公室稱為金管局，金融管理專員即為金管局總裁。

金融管理專員根據《銀行業條例》賦予的職責及權力，規管及監管銀行業務與接受存款業務。根據《銀行業條例》，金融管理專員負責處理香港持牌銀行、有限制牌照銀行及接受存款公司的認可資格事宜。

《金融機構（處置機制）條例》指定金融管理專員為銀行界實體的處置機制當局。該條例賦予金融管理專員一系列權力，對有關實體進行有秩序處置，以減低有關實體不可持續經營對香港金融體系的穩定及有效運作構成的風險。

《證券及期貨條例》及《強制性公積金計劃條例》賦予金融管理專員若干有關銀行證券及強制性公積金業務的權力。

《保險業條例》訂明可就銀行的保險業務向金融管理專員轉授查察及調查權力。

《打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集條例》賦權金融管理專員監管銀行遵守該條例的規定。

《存款保障計劃條例》授予金融管理專員責任，就存款保障計劃的運作提供協助，以及啟動從存款保障計劃基金向無力償付銀行的存款人發放補償。

金融管理專員在《支付系統及儲值支付工具條例》的法定架構下，可指定及監察對香港貨幣或金融穩定或對香港發揮作為國際金融中心的功能事關重要的結算及交收系統。該條例亦授權金融管理專員管理儲值支付工具發牌制度，及指定零售支付系統並監察該等系統的運作是否安全及有效率。

# 金管局與香港特別行政區政府

金管局是香港特別行政區政府架構的一部分，但可以按與公務員不同的聘用條款聘請員工，以吸引具適當經驗與專門知識的人才。金管局總裁及其員工均為公職人員。金管局的日常運作，在金融管理專員所獲賦予或轉授的法定權力範圍內高度自主。

財政司司長負責釐定香港的貨幣政策目標及貨幣體制：財政司司長於2003年6月25日致金融管理專員的函件中，訂明應透過貨幣發行局制度維持貨幣穩定，將港元匯率保持在約7.80港元兌1美元的水平。金融管理專員須自行負責達成貨幣政策目標，包括決定有關的策略、工具及執行方式，並負責維持香港貨幣制度的穩定與健全。

財政司司長在財經事務及庫務局局長的協助下，負責維持香港金融體系穩定與健全，以及保持香港的國際金融中心地位的政策。為推行這些政策，金融管理專員的職責包括：
- 促進銀行體系的整體穩定與有效運作
- 與其他有關機構與組織合作，發展債務市場
- 處理與法定紙幣及硬幣的發行及流通有關的事宜
- 透過發展支付、結算及交收系統，以及在適當情況下負責操作有關系統，促進金融基建的安全與效率
- 與其他有關機構與組織合作，促進對香港貨幣及金融體系的信心，並推行適當的發展市場措施，以協助加強香港金融服務的國際競爭力。

外匯基金由財政司司長掌有控制權。金融管理專員須根據財政司司長轉授的權力，就外匯基金的運用及投資管理向財政司司長負責。

# 問責性與透明度

就日常運作及推行政府政策目標所採用的方法，金管局一直保持高度自主，並同時輔以高問責性及透明度。

金管局致力促進貨幣與銀行體系穩定，有效管理官方儲備，發展與監察穩健及多元化的金融基建，從而鞏固香港的國際金融中心地位，推動香港經濟發展。

金管局要有效履行職責，便必須取得社會人士的信心。因此，金管局以嚴謹的態度，履行向公眾解釋其政策及工作的責任，並盡力處理社會上備受關注而涉及金管局職責範圍的事項。

金融管理專員由財政司司長委任，因此金管局透過財政司司長向公眾負責；而由於金管局的職權由立法會通過的法律制訂，因此金管局亦透過立法會向公眾負責。此外，金管局亦明白本身肩負更廣泛的責任，就是促進公眾對金管局角色及目標的認識，並密切留意社會人士所關注的事項。金管局在執行日常工作及與社會保持廣泛聯繫時，堅守盡力提高透明度及保持開放的政策。這項政策有兩大目標：
- 在顧及市場敏感性、商業秘密及機密資料披露的法定限制下，盡量使金融界及公眾充分了解金管局的工作；
- 確保金管局掌握社會脈搏，並對公眾意見作出適當回應。

金管局在透明度方面致力達致國際最高標準，與傳媒保持廣泛聯繫之餘，亦出版各種中英文期刊及專題刊物。金管局的雙語網站(www.hkma.gov.hk)除有專門環節列載經濟研究、統計資料、消費者資訊及其他課題外，還載有金管局出版的刊物、新聞稿、演辭及簡報會資料文件。此外，金管局又利用社交媒體平台，以能在數碼時代中更有效與公眾溝通。金管局辦事處設有資訊中心，分為圖書館及展覽館兩部分，每星期開放6日予公眾參觀及使用。金管局亦舉辦公眾教育活動，透過講座及資訊中心導賞服務，向公眾人士（特別是學生）講解金管局的工作，以及增進市民的金融知識。有關金管局的傳媒聯繫工作、刊物及公眾教育活動的詳細資料，見「機構職能」一章。

金管局公布外匯基金及貨幣發行局帳目資料的次數，一直逐步增加，內容亦越趨詳細。金管局於1999年開始參與國際貨幣基金組織的中央銀行「數據公布特殊標準」計劃。金管局亦公布外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下貨幣發行委員會的會議紀錄，以及貨幣發行局制度運作報告。自1996年起，金管局網站亦載有銀行業監管政策及指引。

金管局與立法會的關係對提高問責性及透明度非常重要。金管局總裁承諾每年3次向立法會財經事務委員會簡報金管局各項工作及政策，並回答有關查詢。此外，金管局代表亦會不時出席立法會財經事務委員會及法案委員會會議，闡釋及商討特別事項，以及協助議員審閱條例草案。

# 諮詢委員會及其他委員會

# 外匯基金諮詢委員會

財政司司長行使外匯基金的控制權時，會聽取外匯基金諮詢委員會的意見。外匯基金諮詢委員會根據《外匯基金條例》第3(1)條成立。該項條文訂明財政司司長行使對外匯基金的控制權時，須諮詢外匯基金諮詢委員會的意見。財政司司長為外匯基金諮詢委員會的當然主席，其他委員（包括金融管理專員）則以個人身分，由財政司司長根據香港特別行政區行政長官的授權委任。委員因各具專業知識及經驗而獲委任，他們的加入讓外匯基金諮詢委員會廣受裨益。委員的專業知識及經驗涵蓋貨幣、金融、經濟、投資、會計、管理、商業及法律等範疇。

外匯基金諮詢委員會下設5個專責委員會，負責監察金管局特定環節的工作，並透過外匯基金諮詢委員會向財政司司長報告及提出建議。外匯基金諮詢委員會在2018年共舉行5次會議，討論各項與金管局工作有關的事宜，其中大部分事項均由有關的專責委員會事先進行討論。

管治委員會監察金管局的表現，以及就金管局薪酬與服務條件、人力資源政策、財政預算、行政及管治事務，向外匯基金諮詢委員會提出建議。該委員會在2018年共召開5次會議，內容涵蓋金管局的開支預算、表現評估、年度薪酬檢討及策略性規劃事宜。該委員會亦審議金管局定期提交的工作報告。

審核委員會檢討金管局的財政匯報程序，並評核其內部管控制度是否足夠和有效，以及提交報告。審核委員會負責檢視金管局的財務報表，編製該等報表的組成項目與會計原則，並聯同外部及內部審計師查核其審計範疇與結果。審核委員會各委員在金管局並沒有任何行政職能。該委員會在2018年共召開2次會議，並審議風險委員會及內部審核處的工作報告。

貨幣發行委員會監察貨幣發行局制度的運作，並匯報這個作為香港聯繫匯率制度支柱的情況。該委員會負責確保貨幣發行局制度按照既定政策運作、提出改進該制度的建議，以及確保該制度的運作維持高透明度。金管局定期公布貨幣發行委員會的會議紀錄及提交該委員會的貨幣發行局制度運作報告。該委員會在2018年共召開4次會議。

# Introduction to the Hong Kong Monetary Authority

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) is Hong Kong's central banking institution, with four main functions: maintaining monetary stability within the framework of the linked exchange rate system; promoting the stability and soundness of the financial system (including the banking system); assisting in consolidating Hong Kong's status as an international financial center, including maintaining and developing Hong Kong's financial infrastructure; and managing the Exchange Fund.

# Statutory Authority of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority

The Legislative Council (formerly the Legislative Council) passed amendments to the Exchange Fund Ordinance in 1992, authorizing the Financial Secretary (formerly the Financial Secretary) to appoint the Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, which was subsequently established on April 1, 1993.

The powers, functions, and responsibilities of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) are explicitly stipulated in the Exchange Fund Ordinance, the Banking Ordinance, the Financial Institutions (Resolution Mechanism) Ordinance, the Deposit Protection Scheme Ordinance, the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance, and other relevant ordinances. The exchange of letters between the Financial Secretary and the HKMA dated 25 June 2003 outlines the allocation of their respective roles and responsibilities in monetary and financial matters, and also discloses that the Financial Secretary delegated certain powers to the HKMA. The relevant document is a public file and can be accessed on the HKMA's website.

The Exchange Fund was established under the Exchange Fund Ordinance and is under the control of the Financial Secretary. The Ordinance stipulates that the Exchange Fund must primarily be used for affecting the exchange rate of the Hong Kong dollar. The Financial Secretary may also use the Exchange Fund to maintain the stability and soundness of Hong Kong's monetary and financial system, thereby maintaining Hong Kong's status as an international financial center.

The Financial Secretary is appointed under the Exchange Fund Ordinance to assist the Chief Financial Secretary in performing the functions conferred upon them under the Ordinance, as well as other functions assigned by the Chief Financial Secretary under other ordinances. The office of the Financial Secretary is known as the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA), and the Financial Secretary is the Governor of the HKMA.

The Financial Secretary, under the powers and duties conferred by the Banking Ordinance, regulates and supervises banking operations and deposit-taking businesses. Under the Banking Ordinance, the Financial Secretary is responsible for handling matters relating to the approval of qualifications for licensed banks, restricted license banks, and deposit-taking companies in Hong Kong.

The Financial Institutions (Resolution Mechanism) Ordinance designates the Financial Institutions Authority as the resolution authority for banking entities. The Ordinance grants the Financial Institutions Authority a range of powers to carry out orderly resolution of the relevant entities, thereby reducing the risk posed to the stability and effective operation of the Hong Kong financial system by the entities' unsustainable operations.

The Securities and Futures Ordinance and the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance grant the Financial Secretary certain powers relating to banking, securities, and mandatory provident fund businesses.

The Insurance Ordinance stipulates that the powers of inspection and investigation regarding a bank's insurance business may be delegated to the Financial Secretary.

The Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance empowers the Financial Services Commissioner to regulate banks' compliance with the provisions of the Ordinance.

The Deposit Protection Scheme Ordinance empowers the Financial Secretary to provide assistance in the operation of the deposit protection scheme and to initiate the payment of compensation to depositors of insolvent banks from the deposit protection scheme fund.

Under the statutory framework of the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance, the Financial Management Commissioner may designate and supervise settlement and clearing systems that are critical to Hong Kong's currency stability, financial stability, or its role as an international financial center. The Ordinance also authorizes the Financial Management Commissioner to manage the licensing regime for stored value facilities and to designate retail payment systems, overseeing the safe and efficient operation of these systems.

# Hong Kong Monetary Authority and the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) is part of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Government structure, but it can hire employees under different terms of employment from those applicable to civil servants in order to attract individuals with appropriate experience and specialized knowledge. The HKMA's Chief Executive and its staff are all public officials. The HKMA's daily operations are highly autonomous within the scope of legal powers granted to or delegated by the Financial Secretary.

The Financial Secretary is responsible for determining Hong Kong's monetary policy objectives and currency system. In a letter dated June 25, 2003, addressed to the Hong Kong Monetary Authority, the Financial Secretary specified that currency stability should be maintained through the Exchange Fund system, keeping the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate at approximately 7.80 Hong Kong dollars to 1 US dollar. The Hong Kong Monetary Authority is autonomously responsible for achieving monetary policy objectives, including deciding on relevant strategies, tools, and methods of implementation, and for maintaining the stability and soundness of Hong Kong's currency system.

The Financial Secretary, with the assistance of the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury, is responsible for policies aimed at maintaining the stability and soundness of Hong Kong's financial system and preserving Hong Kong's status as an international financial center. To implement these policies, the Financial Controller's responsibilities include:  
- Promoting the overall stability and effective operation of the banking system  
- Collaborating with other relevant institutions and organizations to develop debt markets  
- Handling matters related to the issuance and circulation of legal tender notes and coins  
- Enhancing the safety and efficiency of financial infrastructure by developing payment, settlement, and clearing systems, and operating such systems when appropriate  
- Working with other relevant institutions and organizations to strengthen confidence in Hong Kong's currency and financial system, and implementing appropriate market development measures to enhance the international competitiveness of Hong Kong's financial services.

The Financial Secretary holds control over the foreign exchange fund. The Financial Controller must be responsible to the Financial Secretary for the management and investment of the foreign exchange fund, acting under the delegated authority granted by the Financial Secretary.

# Accountability and Transparency

In terms of the methods used in daily operations and the implementation of government policy objectives, the HKMA has consistently maintained a high degree of autonomy, coupled with strong accountability and transparency.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority is committed to promoting the stability of the monetary and banking system, effectively managing official reserves, developing and overseeing a robust and diversified financial infrastructure, thereby consolidating Hong Kong's status as an international financial center and driving Hong Kong's economic development.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority must gain the confidence of the public to effectively perform its duties. Therefore, it adopts a rigorous approach in fulfilling its responsibility of explaining its policies and operations to the public, and makes every effort to address matters of public concern that fall within its scope of responsibilities.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) is appointed by the Financial Secretary, and therefore the HKMA is accountable to the public through the Financial Secretary. Furthermore, since the HKMA's powers are established by laws passed by the Legislative Council, the HKMA is also accountable to the public through the Legislative Council. In addition, the HKMA recognizes its broader responsibility to promote public understanding of its role and objectives, and to closely monitor issues of public concern. In carrying out its daily operations and maintaining extensive engagement with society, the HKMA adheres to a policy of striving to enhance transparency and maintain openness. This policy has two main objectives:
- To the extent possible, to ensure that the financial sector and the public fully understand the HKMA's work, while taking into account statutory restrictions on the disclosure of market-sensitive information, commercial secrets, and confidential data;
- To ensure that the HKMA remains attuned to public sentiment and appropriately responds to public opinion.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) strives to achieve international best standards in transparency. In addition to maintaining extensive media contacts, the HKMA publishes a variety of bilingual journals and special publications. The HKMA's bilingual website (www.hkma.gov.hk) features dedicated sections listing economic research, statistical data, consumer information, and other topics, as well as publications, press releases, speeches, and briefing documents issued by the HKMA. Furthermore, the HKMA utilizes social media platforms to enable more effective communication with the public in the digital age. The HKMA's office houses an information center, divided into a library and an exhibition hall, which is open to the public six days a week. The HKMA also organizes public education activities, through lectures and guided tours of the information center, to explain the HKMA's work to the public, particularly students, and to enhance the public's financial knowledge. Detailed information on the HKMA's media relations, publications, and public education activities can be found in the "Institutional Functions" chapter.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) has progressively increased the frequency and detail of its disclosures regarding the Exchange Fund and the Currency Board's accounts. The HKMA began participating in the International Monetary Fund's (IMF) Special Data Dissemination Standard (SDDS) program for central banks in 1999. It also publishes the meeting records of the Currency Board Committee under the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee, as well as operational reports on the Currency Board system. Since 1996, the HKMA's website has also featured banking supervision policies and guidelines.

The relationship between the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) and the Legislative Council (LegCo) is crucial for enhancing accountability and transparency. The HKMA Governor has committed to briefing the LegCo Financial Affairs Committee three times a year on the HKMA's various operations and policies, as well as answering related inquiries. In addition, HKMA representatives will attend meetings of the LegCo Financial Affairs Committee and Bill Committees from time to time to explain and discuss specific matters, and assist legislators in reviewing draft legislation.

# Advisory Committee and Other Committees

# Foreign Exchange Fund Advisory Committee

When the Chief Secretary for Financial Services exercises control over the Exchange Fund, the opinion of the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee will be sought. The Exchange Fund Advisory Committee was established under Section 3(1) of the Exchange Fund Ordinance. This provision stipulates that the Chief Secretary for Financial Services must consult the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee when exercising control over the Exchange Fund. The Chief Secretary for Financial Services is the ex-officio chairman of the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee, while the other members (including the Financial Secretary) are appointed by the Chief Secretary for Financial Services on behalf of the Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region. Members are appointed for their respective professional expertise and experience, and their inclusion greatly benefits the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee. Their expertise and experience cover fields such as currency, finance, economics, investment, accounting, management, commerce, and law.

The Foreign Exchange Fund Advisory Committee has established five specialized committees, which are responsible for overseeing specific aspects of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's operations and reporting to and making recommendations to the Financial Secretary through the Foreign Exchange Fund Advisory Committee. In 2018, the Foreign Exchange Fund Advisory Committee held five meetings to discuss various matters related to the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's work, with most of these matters having been discussed in advance by the relevant specialized committees.

The Governance Committee oversees the performance of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) and makes recommendations to the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee regarding the HKMA's salaries and service conditions, human resources policies, financial budget, and administrative and governance matters. The Committee held five meetings in 2018, covering topics such as the HKMA's expenditure budget, performance evaluation, annual salary review, and strategic planning. The Committee also reviewed the regular work reports submitted by the HKMA.

The Audit Committee reviews the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's (HKMA) financial reporting procedures and evaluates the adequacy and effectiveness of its internal control systems, submitting reports accordingly. The Audit Committee is responsible for examining the HKMA's financial statements, the components of such statements, and the accounting principles applied, and for jointly reviewing the audit scope and results with external and internal auditors. Members of the Audit Committee hold no administrative functions within the HKMA. The Committee held two meetings in 2018, during which it reviewed the work reports of the Risk Committee and the Internal Audit Department.

The Currency Board oversees the operation of the currency issuance system and reports on its role as a pillar of Hong Kong's linked exchange rate regime. The committee is responsible for ensuring that the currency issuance system operates in accordance with established policies, proposing recommendations for improving the system, and maintaining high transparency in its operations. The HKMA regularly publishes the minutes of Currency Board meetings and submits operational reports on the currency issuance system to the committee. The committee held four meetings in 2018.

# 經濟及金融環境

2018年香港經濟持續擴張，不過隨着金融狀況收緊及貿易保護主義升溫令不明朗因素增加，增長動力於年內有所減弱。隨着全球經濟增長轉弱，預期2019年香港經濟增長亦會減慢。

# 經濟回顧

# 實體經濟活動

2018年香港經濟進一步擴張，不過按年增長速度由第1季的4.6%，逐步減慢至第4季的1.3%（表1），並拖累全年增長率由2017年的3.8%下降至3.0%。經濟擴張轉弱，反映本地需求增長減慢以及經濟持續受淨出口所拖累（圖1）。本地方面，私人消費在第1季強勁增長，但其後增長動力減弱，部分反映貿易保護主義升溫令不明朗因素增加，以及本地資產價格調整帶來的財富減值效應。由於營商信心脆弱，整體投資支出的增長速度亦放緩。外圍方面，貨品出口於首3季大致保持平穩，但在第4季隨着中美貿易摩擦加劇而顯著轉差。貨品進口亦因為出口帶動的需求轉弱而放緩。相比之下，服務輸出錄得較快的全年增長，部分是受惠於訪港旅遊業表現蓬勃，而服務輸入則由於運輸、商業及其他服務增長而得以大致維持增長動力。按淨額計，貿易差額由2017年的順差轉為2018年的小幅逆差，並拖累本地經濟增長。

# 貨幣狀況

主要受到港元與美元負息差下的套息活動所影響，港元兌美元匯率在2018年大致回軟。尤其弱方兌換保證在4月、5月及8月被觸發，促使金管局按照聯繫匯率制度（聯匯制度）所定，在7.85港元兌1美元的水平，向銀行購入港元及沽出美元。按照聯匯制度的設計，港元貨幣基礎因而收縮，表示銀行同業流動性減少，再加上市場預期美國加息，導致港元銀行同業拆息整體上升。由於銀行體系資金成本上升，銀行於9月下旬在美國聯邦基金利率目標區間上調後，調高最優惠貸款利率12.5至25基點。信貸增長方面，部分由於本地經濟增長放緩以及對外貿易表現轉弱，整體銀行貸款的增幅由2017年的16.1%，顯著減慢至2018年的4.4%。

# 通脹

通脹壓力於2018年略為增加。剔除政府一次性紓緩措施的影響後，基本通脹率由2017年的1.7%低位，升至2018年的2.6%，不過仍屬於溫和水平。當中的住屋租金組成項目增幅較快，反映較早前新簽訂私人住宅租金上升的影響（圖2）。更廣泛的分析顯示，名義勞工成本及商用物業租金增長略為加快，令本地成本壓力更趨明顯。隨着香港部分主要進口來源地通脹上升，進口價格通脹亦因而攀升。

# 勞工市場

勞工市場狀況在2018年保持穩健（圖3）。失業率由2017年全年的3.1%下降至2018年的2.8%，是自1997年以來的最低水平。當中大部分主要服務行業的失業率都有所回落，特別是住宿及膳食服務業的跌幅更為顯著。隨着總就業人數及私營機構職位空缺進一步增加，整體勞工需求持續增強，而且勞動人口參與率亦輕微上升。在勞工市場狀況趨緊下，實質工資及收入進一步增加。

資料來源：政府統計處。

# 股市

香港股市走勢在2018年大幅逆轉。恒生指數在2017年強勁的上升動力帶動下，於2018年1月升上33,484點的歷史高位（圖4）。然而，隨着主要中央銀行收緊貨幣政策、中美貿易摩擦加劇及本地經濟增長放緩引起投資者的憂慮，市場的樂觀情緒急劇逆轉。恒生指數在10月下挫至24,586點的低位，在年底則收報25,846點，較一年前下跌13.6%。然而，平均每日成交額則由2017年的882億港元上升至1,074億港元，本港首次公開招股集資總額亦因數間從事新興及創科產業的企業上市而大幅增加。

圖4 資產價格
資料來源：差餉物業估價署及香港交易及結算所有限公司。

# 物業市場

住宅物業市場在2018年上半年保持暢旺，不過在下半年隨着中美貿易摩擦加劇、環球股市調整及本港最優惠利率上升而有所降溫。整體樓價在7月至12月期間由高位回落9%，然而全年計仍錄得2%的升幅（圖4）。由於一手及二手市場的買賣活動於下半年顯著減少，所以物業成交量在2018年亦較前一年下跌7%至57,247宗。此外，置業負擔能力仍然偏緊，樓價與收入比率以及收入槓桿比率分別為17.0及75.7，兩者均遠高於長期平均水平。另一方面，非住宅物業價格在2018年整體上升，惟接近年底時稍見回落。全年計，價格及租金均進一步上升，租金回報率則維持在低位。

# 經濟前景

# 經濟環境

由於全球經濟增長放緩，預期2019年香港經濟增長將會減慢。尤其外圍環境充滿挑戰，預期香港出口表現仍會受壓。本地方面，雖然失業率低企及家庭收入增加將繼續支撐私人消費，但部分由於消費信心減弱及較早前的資產價格調整帶來的財富減值效應的影響，預期私人消費增長步伐會放緩。固定資本形成方面，雖然隨着房屋供應增加，樓宇及建造活動應會穩步增長，但面對經濟不明朗因素增加，企業對於資本投資可能會變得更為審慎。政府預測2019年實質本地生產總值增長率介乎2至3%之間，私營機構分析員的最新預測增幅則平均為2.3%。

# 通脹及勞工市場

由於包括香港在內的全球增長放緩，外圍物價及本地成本壓力或會得到紓緩，因此預期通脹壓力在2019年仍保持溫和。近期新簽訂住宅租金回落，亦會對通脹產生壓抑作用。市場共識預測2019年整體通脹率為2.2%，政府預期基本通脹率則為2.5%。預期在經濟持續增長及訪港旅遊業維持暢旺下，勞工市場狀況會繼續偏緊。私營機構分析員預計失業率於2019年會維持於約3%的水平。

# 不明朗因素及風險

2019年經濟前景受貿易摩擦、美國貨幣政策未來方向、內地經濟表現、英國脫歐及其他地緣政治局勢等不明朗因素及風險所影響。另外，一旦上述的不明朗因素加劇並長期持續，金融市場情緒及營商信心或會大受影響，對本地資產市場及實體經濟活動構成下行壓力。

另外，住宅物業市場受眾多外圍及本地因素所影響，其前景並不明朗。外圍方面，中美貿易摩擦的不確定性將有可能影響市場情緒、經濟前景及金融狀況，使香港物業市場前景繼續蒙上陰影。本地方面，雖然經濟增長放緩，但就業情況及收入增長仍大致穩定，或可支持住宅物業需求。本港利率的走勢某程度上視乎美國未來的政策利率變動，惟後者走勢並不明確。長遠而言，由於過去幾年住宅落成量有所增加，加上政府致力增加土地及房屋供應，預期房屋供求缺口或會收窄。

# 銀行體系表現

儘管外圍不利因素增加，例如中美貿易衝突、英國脫歐及利率正常化，令金融市場波動加劇，香港銀行體系在2018年仍然穩健。銀行體系的資本及流動性狀況穩健，資產質素保持良好。利率趨升令息差擴闊，刺激銀行盈利顯著增加。

# 資產負債表走勢

2018年銀行體系繼續穩步增長，資產負債表擴大5.9%。面對經濟不明朗因素持續，例如主要經濟體之間的貿易衝突及加息等，企業在獲取新貸款方面變得較為保守。年內貸款總額增幅放緩至4.4%，而2017年為16.1%。有關增長受在香港使用的貸款（+6.5%）及在香港境外使用的貸款（+2%）同告增加帶動。另一方面，由於環球貿易環境不明朗，貿易融資下跌7.6%。中國內地相關貸款的增長亦由2017年的17.5%放緩至2018年的1.4%。

銀行體系持有的債務證券總額在2018年底繼續佔總資產的22%，與2017年一樣。由於這些債務證券大部分為政府及銀行發行的投資級別債務證券，因此有關信用風險維持在低水平。

就負債方而言，存款總額在2018年增加5%，較2017年（+8.7%）的增幅小。由於預期美國持續加息，部分銀行上調定期存款利率，吸引存戶將往來及儲蓄存款轉為定期存款，從而鎖定資金。往來及儲蓄存款佔存款總額的比例由對上一年的57.4%，降至2018年底的51.4%，導致資金成本上升。由於存款總額的增長較貸款總額快，整體貸存比率由2017年底的73%稍降至2018年底的72.6%（圖5）。

# 資本充足水平

銀行體系資本相當充裕，表示其具備強大緩衝以抵禦潛在衝擊。資本比率處於自實施《巴塞爾協定三》以來的歷史高位；本地註冊認可機構的綜合總資本比率由2017年底的19.1%，增加至2018年底的20.3%（圖6）。

圖6 本地註冊認可機構的綜合資本比率

《巴塞爾協定三》槓桿比率於2018年1月1日生效；該比率是一項非風險為本規定，旨在限制銀行體系過度累積槓桿。於2018年底，槓桿比率為8.0%，遠高於3%的法定最低要求（圖7）。

圖7 本地註冊認可機構的綜合槓桿比率

# 流動性狀況

銀行體系的流動性狀況維持穩健，反映其具備強大能力，可有效承受來自潛在金融及經濟壓力的衝擊。短期流動性（涵蓋1個月期資金）方面，第1類機構的平均流動性覆蓋比率在第4季為167.6%，遠高於2018年適用的90%法定最低要求。第2類機構的平均流動性維持比率為54.3%，亦遠高於25%的法定最低要求（圖8）。

# Economic and Financial Environment

Hong Kong's economy continued to expand in 2018, although growth momentum weakened somewhat during the year as tighter financial conditions and rising trade protectionism added to uncertainties. With global economic growth weakening, Hong Kong's economic growth is also expected to slow in 2019.

# Economic Review

# Real Economic Activities

Hong Kong's economy expanded further in 2018, although the year-on-year growth rate slowed progressively from 4.6% in the first quarter to 1.3% in the fourth quarter (Table 1), dragging down the full-year growth rate from 3.8% in 2017 to 3.0%. The weakening economic expansion reflected a slowdown in local demand growth and continued drag from net exports (Figure 1). Locally, private consumption grew strongly in the first quarter but subsequently lost momentum, partly reflecting increased uncertainty due to rising trade protectionism and the wealth erosion effect from local asset price adjustments. Overall investment expenditure also slowed due to fragile business confidence. Externally, goods exports remained largely stable in the first three quarters but deteriorated significantly in the fourth quarter amid escalating Sino-U.S. trade tensions. Goods imports also slowed due to weaker export-driven demand. In contrast, services exports recorded faster annual growth, partly benefiting from robust performance in the tourism sector, while services imports maintained growth momentum largely due to expansion in transport, business, and other services. On a net basis, the trade balance turned from a surplus in 2017 to a small deficit in 2018, dragging down local economic growth.

# Currency Status

Mainly affected by carry trade activities under the negative interest rate differential between the Hong Kong dollar and the US dollar, the Hong Kong dollar weakened against the US dollar in 2018. Particularly, the weak-side exchange guarantee was triggered in April, May, and August, prompting the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) to purchase Hong Kong dollars and sell US dollars at the rate of 7.85 HKD per 1 USD, as stipulated by the Linked Exchange Rate System (LERS). According to the design of the LERS, the contraction of the Hong Kong dollar currency base indicated a reduction in interbank liquidity. Combined with market expectations of US interest rate hikes, this led to an overall increase in Hong Kong interbank interest rates. As the cost of funds in the banking system rose, banks increased their prime lending rates by 12.5 to 25 basis points in late September following the upward adjustment of the US Federal Funds rate target range. In terms of credit growth, partly due to the slowdown in local economic growth and weaker external trade performance, the overall growth rate of bank loans significantly slowed from 16.1% in 2017 to 4.4% in 2018.

# Inflation

Inflation pressures rose slightly in 2018. Excluding the impact of one-time government relief measures, the core inflation rate increased from 1.7% in 2017 to 2.6% in 2018, although it remained at a moderate level. The faster increase in the housing rent component reflected the impact of earlier rises in private residential rents (Figure 2). A broader analysis showed that growth in nominal labor costs and commercial property rents accelerated slightly, making local cost pressures more pronounced. Meanwhile, import price inflation also rose as inflation increased in some of Hong Kong's major import source countries.

Figure 2 Core Consumer Price Inflation. Source: Government Statistics Department.

# Labor Market

The labor market remained robust in 2018 (Figure 3). The unemployment rate declined from 3.1% in 2017 to 2.8% in 2018, the lowest level since 1997. Most major service industries experienced a decrease in unemployment rates, with the accommodation and food service sector recording a particularly significant decline. With the further increase in total employment and private sector job vacancies, overall labor demand continued to strengthen, and the labor force participation rate also rose slightly. As the labor market tightened, real wages and income continued to rise.

Figure 3: Labor Market Conditions. Source: Government Statistics Department.

#StockMarket

The Hong Kong stock market experienced a significant reversal in 2018. Driven by strong upward momentum from 2017, the Hang Seng Index reached a historical high of 33,484 points in January 2018 (Figure 4). However, as major central banks tightened monetary policy, Sino-U.S. trade tensions escalated, and concerns arose over the slowdown in local economic growth, market optimism quickly reversed. The Hang Seng Index fell to a low of 24,586 points in October and closed at 25,846 points by year-end, marking a 13.6% decline compared to the previous year. However, average daily turnover rose from HKD 882 billion in 2017 to HKD 1,074 billion, while the total fundraising from initial public offerings (IPOs) in Hong Kong also surged significantly due to the listing of several companies in emerging and innovative industries.

Figure 4 Asset Prices  
Source: Rates and Valuation Department and Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing Limited.

#PropertyMarket

The residential property market remained robust in the first half of 2018, but cooled in the second half amid escalating Sino-U.S. trade tensions, global stock market adjustments, and rising Hong Kong prime lending rates. Overall property prices fell 9% from their peak between July and December, although they still recorded a 2% annual increase (Figure 4). Due to significantly reduced buying and selling activity in both new and second-hand markets in the second half of the year, property transaction volumes in 2018 declined 7% year-on-year to 57,247 units. Additionally, housing affordability remained tight, with the price-to-income ratio and income leverage ratio standing at 17.0 and 75.7 respectively, both far above long-term averages. On the other hand, non-residential property prices rose overall in 2018, though they slightly declined toward the end of the year. For the full year, both prices and rents increased further, while rental yields remained at low levels.

# Economic Prospects

# Economic Environment

Due to the slowdown in global economic growth, Hong Kong's economic growth is expected to decelerate in 2019. Particularly, the challenging external environment is anticipated to continue pressuring Hong Kong's export performance. Locally, although low unemployment rates and rising household incomes will continue to support private consumption, the growth of private consumption is expected to slow down partly due to weakened consumer confidence and the wealth erosion effect from earlier asset price adjustments. In terms of fixed capital formation, although housing supply increases should lead to steady growth in property and construction activities, businesses may become more cautious about capital investment amid heightened economic uncertainties. The government forecasts real local GDP growth for 2019 to range between 2 to 3 percent, while the latest private sector analysts' forecasts average 2.3 percent.

# Inflation and Labor Market

Due to the global growth slowdown, including Hong Kong, external price pressures and local cost pressures may ease, leading to expectations of moderate inflationary pressures in 2019. Recent declines in newly signed residential rents are also expected to exert a dampening effect on inflation. The market consensus forecasts an overall inflation rate of 2.2% for 2019, while the government expects the core inflation rate to be 2.5%. It is anticipated that the labor market will remain tight, given sustained economic growth and continued strong performance in Hong Kong's tourism sector. Private sector analysts predict the unemployment rate will remain at around 3% in 2019.

# Uncertain Factors and Risks

The economic outlook for 2019 is affected by uncertainties and risks such as trade tensions, the future direction of U.S. monetary policy, mainland economic performance, Brexit, and other geopolitical developments. Furthermore, if these uncertainties intensify and persist in the long term, they could significantly impact financial market sentiment and business confidence, exerting downward pressure on local asset markets and real economic activities.

Additionally, the residential property market is influenced by numerous external and local factors, and its outlook remains uncertain. Externally, the uncertainty surrounding U.S.-China trade tensions could affect market sentiment, economic prospects, and financial conditions, continuing to cast a shadow over the Hong Kong property market. Locally, although economic growth has slowed, employment conditions and income growth remain largely stable, which may support residential property demand. The trajectory of interest rates in Hong Kong depends to some extent on future changes in U.S. policy rates, though the latter's direction remains unclear. In the long term, due to increased residential completions over the past few years, combined with the government's efforts to boost land and housing supply, the housing supply-demand gap is expected to narrow.

# Banking System Performance

Despite an increase in external adverse factors, such as the US-China trade conflict, Brexit, and interest rate normalization, which intensified volatility in financial markets, Hong Kong's banking system remained stable in 2018. The banking system's capital and liquidity positions remained robust, and asset quality remained strong. The rise in interest rates widened interest margins, leading to a notable rise in banking sector profits.

# Balance Sheet Trend

In 2018, the banking system continued its steady growth, with the balance sheet expanding by 5.9%. Faced with persistent economic uncertainties, such as trade conflicts between major economies and interest rate hikes, enterprises became more conservative in obtaining new loans. Total loan growth for the year slowed to 4.4%, down from 16.1% in 2017. This growth was driven by increases in loans used in Hong Kong (+6.5%) and loans used outside Hong Kong (+2%). On the other hand, trade financing fell by 7.6% due to uncertain global trade conditions. Growth in loans related to mainland China also slowed from 17.5% in 2017 to 1.4% in 2018.

The total amount of debt securities held by the banking system continued to account for 22% of total assets at the end of 2018, the same as in 2017. As most of these debt securities are investment-grade debt issued by the government and banks, the related credit risk has remained at a low level.

From the liability side, total deposits increased by 5% in 2018, a smaller growth rate compared to 2017's 8.7%. Due to expectations of continued U.S. interest rate hikes, some banks raised fixed deposit rates to encourage depositors to convert their current and savings deposits into fixed deposits, thereby locking in funds. The proportion of current and savings deposits in total deposits fell from 57.4% in the previous year to 51.4% by the end of 2018, leading to higher funding costs. As the growth rate of total deposits outpaced that of total loans, the overall loan-to-deposit ratio slightly declined from 73% at the end of 2017 to 72.6% by the end of 2018 (Figure 5).

Figure 5: Loans and Deposits in the Banking System

# Capital Adequacy Level

The banking system's capital is sufficiently ample, indicating it has a strong buffer to withstand potential shocks. Capital ratios have reached historical highs since the implementation of Basel III; the combined total capital ratio of locally registered authorized institutions increased from 19.1% at the end of 2017 to 20.3% at the end of 2018 (Figure 6).

Figure 6: Comprehensive Capital Ratio of Locally Registered Recognized Institutions

The Basel III leverage ratio took effect on January 1, 2018; this ratio is a non-risk-based regulation aimed at limiting excessive leverage accumulation in the banking system. By the end of 2018, the leverage ratio stood at 8.0%, significantly higher than the 3% statutory minimum requirement (Figure 7).

Figure 7: Comprehensive Leverage Ratio of Locally Registered Recognized Institutions

# Liquidity Status

The banking system's liquidity situation remained robust, reflecting its strong capacity to effectively withstand potential financial and economic pressures. In terms of short-term liquidity (covering one-month funding), the average liquidity coverage ratio for Category 1 institutions was 167.6% in the fourth quarter, far exceeding the 90% statutory minimum requirement applicable in 2018. The average liquidity maintenance ratio for Category 2 institutions was 54.3%, also significantly above the 25% statutory minimum requirement (Figure 8).

# 貨幣穩定

2018年港元利率普遍上升，而港元現貨匯率則回軟，並貼近弱方兌換保證匯率的水平。儘管如此，港元外匯及貨幣市場運作仍然暢順有序。聯繫匯率制度是香港貨幣及金融穩定的基石，並繼續展現其承受強大衝擊的能力。

# 目標

香港貨幣政策的主要目標是維持貨幣穩定，即確保港元匯價穩定，使港元在外匯市場兌美元的匯率保持在7.75至7.85港元兌1美元的區間內。該貨幣體制主要採用貨幣發行局制度，規定由外匯基金所持的美元儲備向貨幣基礎提供最少百分之百的支持；貨幣基礎若有變動，美元儲備亦必須作出相應增減，與貨幣基礎的變動百分之百配合。

貨幣基礎（表1）包括：
- 負債證明書（為3間發鈔銀行發行的銀行紙幣提供十足支持）
- 政府發行的流通紙幣及硬幣
- 銀行在金管局所持結算戶口的結餘總額（即總結餘）
- 金管局代表政府發行的外匯基金票據及債券。

金管局透過自動利率調節機制及履行兌換保證的堅決承諾來維持港元匯率的穩定。若市場對港元的需求大過供應，令市場匯率轉強至7.75港元兌1美元的強方兌換保證匯率，金管局會向銀行沽出港元、買入美元，使總結餘增加及港元利率下跌，從而令港元匯率從強方兌換保證匯率水平回復至7.75到7.85的兌換範圍內。相反，若港元供過於求，令市場匯率轉弱至7.85港元兌1美元的弱方兌換保證匯率，金管局會向銀行買入港元，使總結餘減少及推高港元利率，港元匯率隨之由弱方兌換保證匯率水平回復至兌換範圍內。

# 2018年回顧

# 匯率穩定

在港元與美元負息差擴闊帶動套息活動的背景下，港元匯率自年初以來逐步轉弱。於4月12日，弱方兌換保證在2005年訂於7.85水平以來首度被觸發。全年計，弱方兌換保證在2018年合共被觸發27次，分別在4月被觸發13次，5月6次，以及8月8次。儘管如此，港元交易仍然暢順有序，港元匯率於4月中至9月中在弱方兌換保證匯率7.85附近徘徊（圖1）。其後港元匯率略為轉強，部分反映假期、季結及年結臨近，銀行同業流動性收緊，帶動部分套息交易平倉。同時，某程度上港元亦受到11月初股市氣氛好轉支持。整體而言，港元外匯市場在2018年全年正常運作。

# 貨幣市場

由於觸發弱方兌換保證後銀行同業流動性減少，以及市場預期美國加息，香港銀行同業拆息在2018年內普遍上升。受新股集資活動相關的資金需求增加及季節性流動資金需求帶動，短期銀行同業拆息更出現較大波幅（圖3）。整體而言，短期銀行同業拆息在2018年大致維持在低於基本利率的水平。鑑於銀行體系資金成本上升，在9月下旬美國聯邦基金利率目標範圍上調後，銀行調高最優惠貸款利率12.5至25基點。

# 聯繫匯率制度

聯匯制度自1983年實施以來，直是維持香港貨幣及金融穩定的重要基石；並在多次區內以至全球金融危機考驗下，展現其承受強大衝擊的能力。由於港元轉弱，作為聯匯制度設計一部分的弱方兌換保證於4月、5月及8月被多次觸發。資金流出港元，是香港利率正常化的必經過程，亦是聯匯制度下的正常運作。為增進各界對有關操作及聯匯制度機制的了解，金管局致力向公眾闡釋聯匯制度的技術細節，並展示香港金融體系應對衝擊的能力。政府亦堅決維持聯匯制度。外匯及貨幣市場保持穩定，進一步鞏固公眾對政府的承擔，以及港元作為支付及保值貨幣的信心。國際貨幣基金組織在與香港進行2018年第四條磋商時，重申對聯匯制度的支持，並指出聯匯制度仍然是最適合香港的貨幣制度，是維持穩定的支柱，有助確保經濟持續增長、維持競爭力及促進龐大的金融服務業暢順運作。

鑑於穩健的銀行體系對聯匯制度的正常運作具關鍵作用，金管局繼續密切監察銀行的信用、流動性及利率風險管理，以及壓力測試結果，並維持對銀行的企業、物業相關及內地相關貸款的監管，以確保銀行體系具備承受衝擊的能力。銀行持有大量外匯基金票據及債券，可經貼現窗用作換取港元流動資金，為利率大幅波動的情況提供有效緩衝。金管局隨時準備透過調整外匯基金票據及債券的發行量以提供額外流動性，以應對資金可能急劇流出港元的情況。金管局亦提醒市民審慎管理市場及利率風險，並為可能出現的市場波動作好準備。

為提高貨幣發行局帳目的透明度，自1998年10月起，外匯基金已有部分資產被指定用作支持貨幣基礎。支持比率（即支持資產相對貨幣基礎的比率）於2018年在107.8至109.9%之間上落，並無觸及上限或下限。該比率於12月31日為109.9%（圖5）。在聯匯制度下，雖然已指定某些外匯基金資產作為支持組合，但外匯基金的全部資產均可用作支持港元匯率。外匯基金的龐大財政資源，能在面對突如其來的衝擊時為保障香港的貨幣及金融穩定提供強力後盾。

# 貨幣發行委員會

外匯基金諮詢委員會轄下的貨幣發行委員會（貨幣發行委員會）負責監察和探討與香港貨幣及金融穩定有關的課題。在2018年，貨幣發行委員會探討的課題包括多國央行聯合退出非常規貨幣政策對在香港的境外銀行美元貸款供應造成的潛在影響、港元貨幣需求的利率敏感度，以及聯匯制度自3項優化措施以來的運作機制及理論。貨幣發行委員會會議紀錄及金管局向其呈交的貨幣發行局制度運作報告，均載於金管局網站。

# 研究

香港金融研究中心（研究中心）繼續支持貨幣政策、銀行業及金融範疇的研究工作。過去4年，研究中心更着重政策方面的研究，從所舉辦的研討會及訪問學者計劃尤其可見一斑。一方面，研究中心與主要中央銀行及政策研究機構合作，聯合舉辦更多政策相關的研討會。另一方面，在2016年推出專題研究學者計劃，支持更多與金管局政策制定相關的研究項目。

在2018年，研究中心合共邀請16位研究學者到訪，並發表了25份研究論文。年內研究中心亦舉辦了4場國際研討會：
- 於1月舉行的「第9屆中國經濟年度國際研討會」，主題為「中國房地產市場及其對經濟與金融穩定的影響」。研討會由研究中心、國務院發展研究中心市場經濟研究所及中國人民銀行金融研究所合辦，集中討論內地房地產市場相關的課題及風險。
- 於10月舉行由金管局及國際結算銀行合辦的「匯率與貨幣政策框架」研討會。研討會為國際結算銀行於香港的亞太區辦事處成立20周年的慶祝活動之一，旨在探討匯率在貨幣政策框架中的角色。
- 於11月舉行的「2018年中央銀行金融市場微結構的年度研討會」。研討會討論金融市場微結構理論研究、實證研究結果及近期發展相關的政策影響。
- 於11月舉行由金管局、歐洲中央銀行及美國聯邦儲備委員會合辦的「中國經濟的新時代」中國專家網絡研討會。研討會討論內地經濟正面對的迫切問題及其對全球經濟的影響，並特別着重與中央銀行決策者相關的政策議題。這是中國專家網絡研討會首次在歐洲以外地區舉行。

# Monetary Stability

In 2018, Hong Kong dollar interest rates generally rose, while the Hong Kong dollar spot exchange rate softened and approached the weak side of the exchange rate mechanism. Despite this, the Hong Kong dollar foreign exchange and money markets continued to operate smoothly and orderly. The linked exchange rate system remains the cornerstone of Hong Kong's monetary and financial stability and continues to demonstrate its ability to withstand significant shocks.

# Goal

The primary objective of Hong Kong's monetary policy is to maintain currency stability, specifically ensuring the stability of the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate, keeping the exchange rate of the Hong Kong dollar against the US dollar within a range of 7.75 to 7.85 Hong Kong dollars per US dollar in the foreign exchange market. This monetary system mainly adopts a currency board system, which stipulates that the US dollar reserves held by the Exchange Fund must provide at least 100% support for the monetary base; if the monetary base changes, the US dollar reserves must also be adjusted accordingly, perfectly aligning with the changes in the monetary base.

The monetary base (Table 1) includes:
- Promissory notes (providing full support for banknotes issued by three issuing banks)
- Government-issued circulating banknotes and coins
- The total balance of settlement accounts held by banks with the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (i.e., the total reserve)
- Foreign exchange fund notes and bonds issued by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority on behalf of the government.

The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) maintains the stability of the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate through its automatic interest rate adjustment mechanism and its firm commitment to fulfilling the exchange rate guarantee. If market demand for Hong Kong dollars exceeds supply, causing the market exchange rate to rise to the strong-side exchange rate guarantee level of 7.75 Hong Kong dollars per US dollar, the HKMA will sell Hong Kong dollars and buy US dollars from banks, increasing the total surplus and lowering Hong Kong dollar interest rates, thereby bringing the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate back to within the exchange rate band of 7.75 to 7.85. Conversely, if the supply of Hong Kong dollars exceeds demand, causing the market exchange rate to fall to the weak-side exchange rate guarantee level of 7.85 Hong Kong dollars per US dollar, the HKMA will buy Hong Kong dollars from banks, reducing the total surplus and raising Hong Kong dollar interest rates, thus bringing the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate back to within the exchange rate band.

# 2018 Year in Review

# Exchange Rate Stability

Against the backdrop of a widening negative interest rate differential between the Hong Kong dollar and the US dollar, which has spurred carry trade activities, the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate has gradually weakened since the beginning of the year. On April 12, the weak-side exchange rate guarantee, which had been set at the 7.85 level since 2005, was triggered for the first time. Throughout the year, the weak-side exchange rate guarantee was triggered a total of 27 times in 2018, with 13 times in April, 6 times in May, and 8 times in August. Despite this, Hong Kong dollar transactions remained smooth and orderly, with the HKD exchange rate fluctuating around the weak-side exchange rate guarantee level of 7.85 from mid-April to mid-September (Figure 1). Subsequently, the HKD exchange rate slightly strengthened, partly reflecting the tightening of interbank liquidity as holidays, quarter-end, and year-end approached, leading to the unwinding of some carry trade positions. To some extent, the Hong Kong dollar was also supported by improved stock market sentiment in early November. Overall, the Hong Kong dollar foreign exchange market operated normally throughout 2018.

Figure 1 2018 Market Exchange Rate

Due to the activation of the weak-side exchange rate guarantee, the aggregate balance of the Exchange Fund and the total outstanding amount of Exchange Fund notes and bonds decreased from HKD 1,226.8 billion at the end of 2017 to HKD 1,136.2 billion at the end of 2018 (Figure 2). During the year, the HKMA purchased a total of HKD 103.5 billion at the weak-side exchange rate guarantee level of 7.85, as requested by banks under the design of the linked exchange rate system (LERS). As a result, the aggregate balance fell from HKD 179.8 billion at the end of 2017 to HKD 76.4 billion at the end of 2018. The total outstanding amount of Exchange Fund notes and bonds remained largely unchanged during the year. The monetary base continues to be fully supported by foreign exchange reserves.

As of the end of 2018, the total surplus and outstanding foreign exchange fund notes and bonds amounted to HK$1,136.2 billion.

Figure 2: 2018 Total Balance and Outstanding Foreign Exchange Fund Bills and Bonds

# Money Market

Due to a reduction in interbank liquidity following the activation of the weak-side exchange guarantee and market expectations of U.S. interest rate hikes, Hong Kong interbank rates generally rose during 2018. Short-term interbank rates experienced greater volatility driven by increased funding demands related to new share offerings and seasonal liquidity needs (Figure 3). Overall, short-term interbank rates remained largely below the basic interest rate throughout 2018. In response to rising funding costs within the banking system, banks increased their prime lending rates by 12.5 to 25 basis points following the Federal Reserve's upward adjustment of the target range for the federal funds rate in late September.

In response to four rate increases totaling 100 basis points in the US federal funds rate target range during the year, which rose from 1.25% to 1.50% to 2.25% to 2.50%, the basic interest rate was increased by a total of 100 basis points on March 22, June 14, September 27, and December 20, moving from 1.75% to 2.75%. The adjustments to the basic interest rate were made in accordance with the revised calculation formula announced on March 26, 2009. Under this formula, the basic interest rate is set at either the lower bound of the US federal funds rate target range plus 50 basis points, or the average of the 5-day moving average of the overnight and 1-month Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate (HIBOR), whichever is higher.

Figure 3: Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate for 2018

The discount on the Hong Kong dollar forward exchange rate expanded in the first four months, largely following the trend of the interest rate differential between the Hong Kong dollar and the US dollar, with the 12-month Hong Kong dollar forward exchange rate points reaching a negative 620 points in mid-April (Figure 4). Subsequently, as the negative interest rate differential between the Hong Kong dollar and the US dollar narrowed, the discount on the Hong Kong dollar forward exchange rate slightly decreased before expanding again in the fourth quarter. Overall, the Hong Kong money market continued to operate normally. Discount window lending increased from HKD 10.3 billion in 2017 to HKD 40.2 billion in 2018.

Figure 4: 2018 USD to HKD Forward Exchange Rate Points

# Linked Exchange Rate System

The Linked Exchange Rate System, implemented in 1983, has been a crucial cornerstone in maintaining Hong Kong's monetary and financial stability. It has withstood numerous regional and global financial crises, demonstrating its resilience against significant shocks. As the Hong Kong dollar weakened, the Weak-Side Exchange Guarantee, a component of the Linked Exchange Rate System, was triggered multiple times in April, May, and August. Capital outflows from the Hong Kong dollar are a necessary process for the normalization of Hong Kong's interest rates and represent normal operations under the Linked Exchange Rate System. To enhance public understanding of these operations and the mechanisms of the Linked Exchange Rate System, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) has made efforts to explain its technical details to the public and to demonstrate the Hong Kong financial system's ability to withstand shocks. The government remains firmly committed to maintaining the Linked Exchange Rate System. The stability of foreign exchange and money markets further reinforces public confidence in the government's responsibility and in the Hong Kong dollar as a currency for payment and value preservation. During the 2018 Fourth Article Consultation with Hong Kong, the International Monetary Fund (IMF) reiterated its support for the Linked Exchange Rate System, noting that it remains the most suitable monetary system for Hong Kong, serving as a pillar of stability that helps ensure sustained economic growth, maintain competitiveness, and facilitate the smooth operation of Hong Kong's large financial services sector.

Given that a sound banking system is crucial for the normal functioning of the linked exchange rate system, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) continues to closely monitor banks' credit, liquidity, and interest rate risk management, as well as the results of stress tests, while maintaining oversight of banks' corporate, property-related, and mainland China-related loans to ensure the banking system's resilience to shocks. Banks hold substantial amounts of Exchange Fund Bills and Bonds, which can be used through the discount window to obtain Hong Kong dollar liquidity, providing an effective buffer against significant interest rate fluctuations. The HKMA stands ready to provide additional liquidity by adjusting the issuance volumes of Exchange Fund Bills and Bonds to address potential sharp outflows of Hong Kong dollars. The HKMA also reminds the public to prudently manage market and interest rate risks and to prepare for possible market volatility.

To enhance the transparency of the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's accounts, since October 1998, a portion of the Exchange Fund's assets has been designated to support the currency base. The support ratio (i.e., the ratio of supporting assets to the currency base) fluctuated between 107.8% and 109.9% in 2018, without reaching the upper or lower limits. The ratio stood at 109.9% on December 31 (Figure 5). Under the Linked Exchange Rate System, although certain Exchange Fund assets have been designated as part of the support portfolio, all of the Exchange Fund's assets can be used to support the Hong Kong dollar exchange rate. The Exchange Fund's substantial financial resources serve as a strong buffer to safeguard Hong Kong's monetary and financial stability in the face of sudden shocks.

Figure 5: Daily Changes in the Support Ratio in 2018

# Monetary Policy Committee

The Currency Board, which is under the Exchange Fund Advisory Committee, is responsible for monitoring and examining issues related to Hong Kong's monetary and financial stability. In 2018, the Currency Board discussed topics including the potential impact of multiple central banks jointly exiting unconventional monetary policies on the supply of U.S. dollar loans by foreign banks in Hong Kong, the interest rate sensitivity of Hong Kong dollar demand, and the operational mechanisms and theoretical aspects of the linked exchange rate system since the implementation of three optimization measures. The minutes of the Currency Board meetings and the reports on the operation of the Currency Board submitted by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) are available on the HKMA's website.

# Research

The Hong Kong Financial Research Centre (Research Centre) continues to support research in the areas of monetary policy, banking, and finance. Over the past four years, the Research Centre has placed greater emphasis on policy-related research, as evidenced by the seminars it has organized and its scholar visit program. On one hand, the Research Centre collaborates with major central banks and policy research institutions to jointly host more policy-related seminars. On the other hand, it launched the Special Research Scholar Program in 2016 to support more research projects related to the Hong Kong Monetary Authority's (HKMA) policy-making.

In 2018, the research center invited a total of 16 scholars and published 25 research papers. During the year, the research center also organized four international conferences:
- The "9th Annual International Conference on China's Economy," held in January, with the theme "China's Real Estate Market and Its Impact on Economic and Financial Stability." The conference was co-organized by the research center, the Institute of Market Economy of the Development Research Center of the State Council, and the Financial Research Institute of the People's Bank of China. It focused on discussing topics and risks related to the mainland's real estate market.
- The "Exchange Rates and Monetary Policy Framework" conference, held in October and co-organized by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) and the Bank for International Settlements (BIS). This event was part of the BIS's celebrations marking the 20th anniversary of its Asia-Pacific office in Hong Kong, aiming to explore the role of exchange rates within monetary policy frameworks.
- The "2018 Annual Conference on Central Bank Financial Market Microstructure," held in November. The conference discussed theoretical research, empirical findings, and recent developments related to policy implications in financial market microstructure.
- The "China's New Era" expert network seminar, held in November and co-organized by the HKMA, the European Central Bank (ECB), and the U.S. Federal Reserve. The seminar addressed urgent issues facing China's economy and their impact on the global economy, with particular emphasis on policy topics relevant to central bank decision-makers. This marked the first time the China expert network seminar was held outside Europe.

# 銀行體系穩定

儘管環球經濟及金融市場的不確定性增加，2018年香港銀行體系維持穩健。認可機構的流動性及信用風險管理制度的成效繼續是金管局年內的監管重點。鑑於網絡威脅持續增加，以及銀行業更廣泛使用金融科技，金管局加強對認可機構科技風險管理及業務操作恢復能力的監管。金管局亦於5月發出《虛擬銀行的認可》指引修訂本，並開始處理虛擬銀行認可申請。在操守監管方面，金管局採取進一步措施，加強監管認可機構銷售投資及保險產品的手法、促進為殘疾人士提供無障礙銀行服務，以及推動以客為本的企業文化。

隨着金融罪行越趨複雜及全球化，金管局繼續借助新科技及風險為本方法，加強香港打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集制度的應對能力。金管局在香港落實國際監管標準方面進展理想，其中包括資本充足標準、披露標準、流動性標準及大額風險承擔限額。此外，金管局亦加強與銀行業的溝通接觸，確保在監管成效與市場發展兩者間取得適當平衡。

與此同時，金管局繼續致力確保香港備有具公信力的認可機構處置機制，其中包括推出最低吸收虧損能力規定的規則，以解決認可機構處置可行性面對的一大障礙。

# 目標

金管局的整體目標之一是促進銀行體系的安全及穩定。要達致這個目標，實有賴建立及維持具高度應對能力且能為香港經濟提供所需關鍵金融服務的金融體系。

銀行可能因其營運方式，甚或在極端情況下因失序地倒閉而影響銀行體系的穩定。作為監管當局，金融管理專員在保障金融穩定方面擔當重要角色，確保銀行有能力抵禦衝擊、對危機作出應對，並自危機中恢復常態，以最終有助防止出現倒閉。金融管理專員負責對銀行進行審慎監管，以及認可香港的持牌銀行、有限制牌照銀行及接受存款公司（統稱「認可機構」）。金融管理專員亦負責某些金融市場基建的指定及監管。

然而，金融管理專員不能確保金融體系全無風險，香港的審慎監管制度亦非為了確保「零風險」而設。作為其中一個處置機制當局，金融管理專員力求確保一旦有認可機構不再可持續經營，即能有序地處理其倒閉。為此，香港已設立金融機構處置機制，金融管理專員於該機制之下作為包括認可機構在內的若干金融機構的處置機制當局。為建立運作暢順的香港處置機制，必須制定處置法例及政策標準、進行處置規劃以清除認可機構處置可行性的障礙，以及建立金管局處置無法經營的認可機構的運作能力。為有效執行上述工作，金管局需要採納與國際一致及協調的方法。

# 2018年回顧

# 監管工作概覽

金管局在2018年共進行187次非現場審查，涵蓋範圍廣泛，包括認可機構的CAMEL評級、企業管治、業務操作及風險管理，以及認可機構應對金融科技發展的業務策略。為繼續加強認可機構的風險管治水平，金管局與認可機構董事局或董事局轄下委員會共舉行27次會議，並跟進認可機構實施企業管治指引的進度。此外，金管局與認可機構及其外聘核數師共舉行28次三方聯席會議。

除了非現場審查工作外，金管局繼續進行定期現場審查，並以專題評估作為配合，以審視被評估為較高風險的範疇。金管局於年內共進行392次現場審查及專題評估，並繼續以信用風險管理作為審查與評估的主要重點。其他重點為科技風險及業務操作風險管理，以及打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集管控措施。金管局亦增加針對流動性與市場風險管理，以及巴塞爾資本充足架構的實施情況的現場審查及專題評估次數。專項審查小組亦對認可機構的證券、投資產品、保險及強制性公積金（強積金）相關業務進行現場審查。

表1載有金管局於2018年的監管工作概要。

# 信用風險的監管

# 信貸增長及資產質素

2018年信貸增長放緩，全年貸款總額增加4.4%，2017年的增幅則為16.1%（表2）。貿易融資於2018年減少7.6%。貸款增長放緩，主要是因為全球經濟及貿易環境越趨不明朗，以致信貸需求收縮。

表2 貸款及墊款的增長

內地相關貸款總額在2018年底增加1.4%至42,490億港元，低於2017年的增幅（表3）。

表3 內地相關貸款增長

認可機構的資產質素在2018年維持穩健。零售銀行的特定分類貸款比率由2017年底的0.56%下降至2018年底的0.50%，遠低於2000年以來的長期平均水平2.1%；同期，整體銀行業的特定分類貸款比率則由0.68%下降至0.55%。內地相關貸款方面，零售銀行的特定分類貸款比率由0.75%下降至2018年的0.63%，整體銀行業的相關比率亦由一年前的0.67%下降至0.54%。

年內金管局加強監管，確保認可機構繼續採取審慎的信用風險管理準則。尤其金管局更主動了解大型企業的背景及結構，從而加強企業信用風險的監察制度。此外，金管局亦進行以主要信用風險管理監控措施為重點的專題評估，例如大型企業貸款的批核準則及風險管理、貸款分類及撥備制度、信用風險管治架構、地產發展商貸款的風險管理、有抵押貸款及保單抵押貸款等。

# 物業按揭貸款

住宅物業價格在2018年7月到達歷史高位，但在下半年出現緩和跡象。金管局自2009年10月以來推出的8輪逆周期宏觀審慎監管措施，已增強香港銀行體系應對本港樓市可能逆轉的抵禦能力。新造住宅按揭貸款的平均按揭成數由2009年9月金管局推出首輪逆周期措施前的64%，降至2018年12月的46%。平均供款與入息比率亦由2010年8月首度推出有關比率上限時的41%，降至2018年12月的34%（圖1）。

圖1 新造住宅按揭貸款的平均按揭成數及供款與入息比率

# 業務操作及科技風險的監管

銀行業面對的科技風險仍然偏高。金管局於2016年推出「網絡防衛評估框架」。第一期實施安排涵蓋包括所有大型銀行在內的30間認可機構，該等認可機構已完成3個階段的評估，即自身風險程度評估、成熟程度評估及（如適用）風險資訊主導網絡攻防模擬測試。有關評估有助認可機構查找需要改進的運作範疇及採取補救措施，加強網絡防衛。與此同時，金管局已制定第二及第三期實施安排的時間表，這兩期實施安排將涵蓋其餘認可機構。年內金管局進行現場審查，集中檢視認可機構的網絡保安管控措施、外判安排及資訊科技管治。

# 智慧銀行

金管局繼續就2017年9月公布的7項推動智慧銀行的措施與銀行業合作，以促進金融科技在香港的發展。在監管層面，金管局於5月發出《虛擬銀行的認可》指引修訂本。此外，金管局在「銀行易」措施下，已經精簡有關遙距開戶、網上貸款及網上財富管理的監管要求。這些優化的監管要求有助銀行提供更佳的網上銀行用戶體驗。「銀行易」措施的工作範疇在9月擴大至促進銀行採用金融合規科技(Regtech)，而當中3個新的工作重點包括打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集的監察科技、用於審慎風險管理和合規的金融合規科技，以及「機器可讀」的監管要求。

金管局副總裁阮國恒先生在香港銀行學會主辦的「香港銀行家峰會2018」上發表演辭，題為「智慧銀行新紀元下的金融合規科技」。

# 流動性及市場風險的監管

隨着美國貨幣政策持續正常化，金管局加強了流動性風險的監管，以確保認可機構審慎及有效地管理其流動性風險。年內金管局進行了一輪專題評估，以評估認可機構為美元流動性可能收緊所作的準備，以及其內部流動性壓力測試的能力。此外，金管局亦監察認可機構遵守於1月生效的「穩定資金淨額比率」要求的情況。

金管局除檢視認可機構的債券組合的市場風險管理外，亦進行了針對《環球外匯守則》及非中央結算場外衍生工具的保證金和風險緩解標準的專題現場審查，以審視認可機構在財資業務中遵行新國際標準的情況。

# 打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集

政府於4月發表的《香港洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集風險評估報告》指出，香港銀行體系面對高洗錢威脅，這與其他國際金融中心一樣，亦反映金融服務日趨全球化及複雜。香港面對的洗錢威脅除源自本地犯罪活動外，在更大程度上也來自境外活動。該等境外活動包括來自境外貪污活動的非法得益、跨國犯罪集團的詐騙活動、逃稅及基於香港作為支付及貿易樞紐的地位而引致與制裁相關的風險。在金管局協助下，政府制定打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集政策聲明，列載對該等威脅的回應，目標是在提高打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集制度的應對能力的同時，又能吸引及便利正當企業。

《2018年打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集（金融機構）（修訂）條例》於3月1日生效，引入的修訂包括在核實客戶身分方面賦予靈活性，以配合認可機構利用科技方便客戶開戶的發展。新法例亦擴大適用範圍，規定律師、會計師、地產代理及信託或公司服務提供者須負上打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集的責任，從而全面強化打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集制度。該等修訂連同《公司條例》為提高企業實益擁有權透明度而作出的修訂，有助認可機構執行打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集方面的工作。

為鞏固及進一步強化與認可機構就打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集政策與監管方法的溝通，金管局在10月發出《監管政策手冊》下的全新單元「打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集的監管方法」，及配合相關法例修訂的《打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集指引（認可機構適用）》，以能更有效實施風險為本的方法，並減少認可機構就打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集制度採用新科技的障礙。

資訊交流在打擊洗錢及恐怖分子資金籌集制度中的作用日見重要；在金管局與香港銀行公會（銀行公會）的支持下，銀行業積極參與反訛騙及洗黑錢情報工作組（情報工作組），並已取得實質成果。有關情報工作組先導計劃的檢討工作於2018年末展開，並會於2019年初完成。
